pullrequest.title: Fixed precompiled headers to work in more use-cases.

content.raw:
Since I use a non-system-installed probuf library, I noticed another problem. When calling the generation code, the include paths are not passed to the compiler, so that it doesn't use the right versions of libraries (or wouldn't find them at all if they weren't system-installed).

It is needed to pass `-I` flags to the `add_pch` macro. I think it's always needed for the libraries whose include files are actually used inside the `*_pch.hh` file. And it's IMO important to keep the same order of these include flags as the one specified on the beginning of [`gazebo/gazebo/CMakeLists.txt`](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/cd526975bc8bdf3813e0600e3ece180870602471/gazebo/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-1).
content.html:
Since I use a non-system-installed probuf library, I noticed another problem. When calling the generation code, the include paths are not passed to the compiler, so that it doesn't use the right versions of libraries (or wouldn't find them at all if they weren't system-installed).

It is needed to pass -I flags to the add_pch macro. I think it's always needed for the libraries whose include files are actually used inside the *_pch.hh file. And it's IMO important to keep the same order of these include flags as the one specified on the beginning of gazebo/gazebo/CMakeLists.txt.
